channel.title: Skillcape Emotes
channel.description:
Can anyone walk me through adding skill cape emotes, or at least point me in the direction of a decent tutorial? Currently all the emotes are set as normal dance and wave ans stuff. I looked for a tutorial but couldn't find one :(. By the way, the emotes were for some else! FFS, today is not my day. Also does anyone have an emote list?
Any help?

item.title: Skillcape Emotes
item.dc:creator: @zezimaisme111 zezimaisme111
item.description:
@zezimaisme111 wrote:

were i add capeEmotes(); then?

Read full topic

item.title: Skillcape Emotes
item.dc:creator: @dragonchain dragonchain
item.description:
@dragonchain wrote:

stillgfx(gfxID, absY, absX); Just add the gfxid in.

Read full topic

item.title: Skillcape Emotes
item.dc:creator: @dragonchain dragonchain
item.description:
@dragonchain wrote:

[quote=“X F U R Y X, post:3, topic:155080”]Here’s a short tut to add the skillcape emote to the yes button…

go to client.java…

then follow dragonchains instructions, then

search for update();

under that add

sendFrame126("@whi@sklcpe", 180);//first emote slot

Then search for: case 168, if you don’t have that search case 169

then if you have case 168 it should have something like

case 168:
startAnimation(#,###);
break;

replace it to this (and if you don’t have it, then make it…)

case 168:
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == capeID) {
stillgfx(gfxID, absY, absX);
stillgfx(gfxID, absY, absX);
stillgfx(gfxID, absY, absX);
}

you need to replace the bold with your ids tho… there I think that’s correct… :/[/quote]

Nope, alls you do is add capeEmote(); to case 168 then break; …

Read full topic

item.title: Skillcape Emotes
item.dc:creator: @X_F_U_R_Y_X X F U R Y X
item.description:
@X_F_U_R_Y_X wrote:

You can basically add it anywhere… you just need to make i neat and stuff thats why people tell you to add it in certain places… just aas log as you don’t add it inside a method, void, boolean or whatever…

Read full topic

item.title: Skillcape Emotes
item.dc:creator: @Syrillia Syrillia
item.description:
@Syrillia wrote:

Oh, lol, mis-read it. OK, hang on.

item.title: Skillcape Emotes
item.dc:creator: @Syrillia Syrillia
item.description:
@Syrillia wrote:

I don’t have a capeEmote void. I’m using an old source that I’m updating. Coul you show me how (and where) to add one? After that, I could do it myself.

Read full topic

item.title: Skillcape Emotes
item.dc:creator: @X_F_U_R_Y_X X F U R Y X
item.description:
@X_F_U_R_Y_X wrote:

Here’s a short tut to add the skillcape emote to the yes button…

go to client.java…

then follow dragonchains instructions, then

search for update();

under that add

sendFrame126("@whi@sklcpe", 180);//first emote slot

Then search for: case 168, if you don’t have that search case 169

then if you have case 168 it should have something like

case 168:
startAnimation(#,###);
break;

replace it to this (and if you don’t have it, then make it…)

case 168:
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == capeID) {
stillgfx(gfxID, absY, absX);
stillgfx(gfxID, absY, absX);
stillgfx(gfxID, absY, absX);
}

you need to replace the bold with your ids tho… there I think that’s correct…

Read full topic

item.title: Skillcape Emotes
item.dc:creator: @dragonchain dragonchain
item.description:
@dragonchain wrote:

In client.java find a public void and under that put:

public void capeEmote() {

Now I am going to go slow in this, now uer that public voi capeEote() code put

if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == capeID) { stillgfx(gfxID, absY, absX); stillgfx(gfxID, absY, absX); stillgfx(gfxID, absY, absX); }

And keep adding those for moe cape emotes, also find a emote case for it, so when you click it, it does the emote, if not you need my help again just post here, but wat you doin the emote case is add capeEmote(); and then your done! So if you need any help with the emote case please do post here.

Read full topic

item.title: Skillcape Emotes
item.dc:creator: @Syrillia Syrillia
item.description:
@Syrillia wrote:

Can anyone walk me through adding skill cape emotes, or at least point me in the direction of a decent tutorial? Currently all the emotes are set as normal dance and wave ans stuff. I looked for a tutorial but couldn’t find one :(. By the way, the emotes were for some else! FFS, today is not my day. Also does anyone have an emote list?

Any help?

Read full topic
